attributes.action: Reform Home Buying so Agreed Sales Require A Deposit & Binding Commitment
attributes.additional_details:
This would bring the system closer to Scotlands where accepted offers are binding, reducing failed sales and giving buyers and sellers more certainty.
In England and Wales nearly a third of sales collapse after an offer is accepted causing wasted money, delays and stress. A binding commitment at the point of sale would:
Cut the number of failed transactions
Protect both buyer and seller form wasted costs
Make the process faster, fairer and more reliable
Its time to modernise home buying
attributes.background: We call on the Government to reform home buying in England and Wales so that when a sale is agreed, the buyer must place a deposit. If either party withdraws for reasons other than genuine exceptional circumstances, they lose the deposit.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition, which calls for a similar action: "Amend the home buying process in England to align with Scotland" https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/739512
